name: luxuriantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(usually of plants or hair) in a way that grows thickly, strongly, and well: The park is luxuriantly full of vegetation. Villages nestle on luxuriantly green slopes near terraced rice fields.
in a way that is pleasantly thick or full: He had the most beautiful, luxuriantly long eyelashes. We settled into the luxuriantly refurbished seats. See
luxuriant
More examplesFewer examplesWe hiked along the luxuriantly foliage-shrouded bank of the river.Grasses grow luxuriantly in northern areas.The text of the opera is luxuriantly lyrical.
